title: Manhattan Dawn

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on canvas.

artist_display:
Lyonel Feininger
American, worked in Germany, 1871–1956
inscriptions:
signed upper right:  Feininger
signed, dated and titled on verso stretcher: 
Lyonel Feininger, 1944, MANHATTAN DAWN
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Andreas Feininger
publication_history:
Hans Hess, Lyonel Feininger (New York: Abrams, 1961), p. 149, pl. 21 (color ill.), 153, 291, no. 444.

Welmoed Laanstra, curator, Art in Embassies Exhibition, exh. cat. (Washington D.C.: Art in Embassies, 2020), n.p.(color ill.).
exhibition_history:
New York, Museum of Modern Art, Lyonel Feininger/Marsden Hartley, October 24, 1944–January  14, 1945, p.  47, no cat. no.

New York, Buchholz Gallery, Lyonel Feininger: Recent Paintings, Watercolors, January 29-February 23, 1946, no. 4, as Manhattan-Dawn.

Possibly New York , Wildenstein and Company, Sixth Annual Exhibition of Paintings and Sculptures by Members of the Federation of Modern Painters and Sculptors, September 18–October 5, 1946, no. 13.

Cleveland Museum of Art, The Work of Lyonel Feininger, November 2-December 9, 1951, p. 17, pl. XII, no. 32 (ill.).

New York, Museum of Modern Art (organizer), Three Modern Painters: Beckmann­-Feininger-Hartley; traveled to Memphis, Brooks Memorial Art Gallery, November 1955; New Orleans, Tulane University, January 7-28, 1956; Winston-Salem, North Carolina, Public Library of Winston-Salem, February 12-March 4, 1956; Georgetown, Texas, Southwestern  University, March 26-April 6, 1956; Louisville, Kentucky, J. B. Speed Art Museum, May 5-26, 1956; Exeter, New Hampshire, Phillips Exeter Academy, October
5-26, 1956; Winter Park, Florida, The Morse Gallery of Art, Rollins College, November 15-December 6, 1956; Richmond  Artists Association, January 5-26, 1957; Moorhead, Minnesota, Concordia College, February 8-March 1, 1957; Gainesville, University of Florida, March 15-April 5, 1957; Savannah, Georgia, Telfair Academy  of Arts, April 21-May 12, 1957; Chattanooga, Tennessee, Hunter Gallery of Art, May 26-June 16, 1957.

San Francisco Museum of Art, Lyonel Feininger Memorial Exhibition, 1959-1961, November 5-December 13, 1959; traveled to Minneapolis Institute of Arts, January 5- February 7, 1960; Cleveland Museum of Art, February 18-March 20, 1960; Buffalo, Albright-Knox Art Gallery, April 8-May 8, 1960; and Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, May 19-June 26, 1960, p. 16, no.  53.

New York, Willard Gallery, Lyonel Feininger: Architecture, Paris-New York, March 1-31, 1961, cat. 4.

Possibly Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Academy of the Pine Arts, Lyonel Feininger April 18–May 26, 1968, cat. 14. 

New York, Marlborough-Gerson Gallery, Lyonel Feininger, April-May, 1969, p. 13, 75, cat. 58 (color ill.).

Munich, Haus der Kunst, Lyonel Feininger, 1871-1956, March 24-May 13, 1973; traveled to Kunsthaus Zurich, May 25-July 22, 1973, p. 90, cat. 150 (ill.).

Los Angeles County Museum of Art, Exiles and Emigres: The Flight of European Artists from Hitler, February 23-May 11, 1997; traveled to Montreal Museum of Fine Arts, June 19-September  7,  1997; and  Berlin,  Neue  Nationalgalerie,  October  9,  1997-January 4, 1998, pp. 299, 300, fig. 294 (color ill.), p. 403, cat. 51.

Madrid, Museo Nacional  Centro de Art Reina  Sofia, Black Mountain College: Experiment in Art, October 28  2002-January 13, 2003, p. 58, 59 (color i ll.), no cat. no.

Shanghai Museum, Pathways to Modernism: American Art, 1965–1945, September 28, 2018-January 6, 2019.

Brussels, United States Embassy, Whitlock Hall, Art in Embassies Exhibition, May 15, 2019–Dec 13, 2020, no cat. no.
provenance_text: The artist; by descent to his wife Julia Feininger (died 1970), New York, 1956; Pat and Theodore Lux Feininger, Cambridge, MA., by 1959 [San Francisco 1959]; Mr. and Mrs. Andreas Feininger, New York, by 1961 [Hess 1961]; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, Dec. 27, 1972.
